item.description:
THIS LISTING IS ONLY TO RESERVE EXTRA CAMPING DAYS (THURSDAY AND/OR MONDAY) AT GOLD BROOK FOR THE STOWE WEEKEND.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

EXTRA DAYS ARE $15 PER PERSON - PER DAY:

-TO RESERVE ONE EXTRA DAY FOR ONE PERSON, RSVP FOR ONE AND THEN PAY $15.

-TO RESERVE TWO EXTRA DAYS FOR ONE PERSON, OR ONE EXTRA DAY FOR TWO PEOPLE, RSVP WITH A "PLUS ONE" AND PAY $30.

-TO RESERVE TWO EXTRA DAYS FOR TWO PEOPLE, RSVP WITH A "PLUS 3" AND THEN PAY $60.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Beautiful Stowe Village, Vermont - I've wanted to plan a trip to Vermont but the lodging has been too expensive.  So, here's a full-amenity campground (with hot showers!) on a river and only a mile from the village of Stowe.

Stowe is a beautiful mountain village with access to many miles of hiking and biking trails, great restaurants, and some very special attractions listed below.  It's a scenic 3 hours from Seacoast, NH.

The $38 fee includes camping and all campground facilities (including hot showers) for 2 nights, Friday through Sunday.

Note: If you can take Friday or Monday off and want to go early or stay longer, send me an email.  I'm arriving early and may stay late. Extra days are $15.

Note to non-campers: I've chosen a full-service campground close to town in part to entice those of you who aren't thrilled at the thought of sleeping in a tent.  Also, if you have neither a tent nor a sleeping bag, you can likely borrow from a friend.  If not, I'm sure many of us have extras.  So, RSVP yes and then indicate in your comments that you need to borrow gear.  A positive attitude is all that's required.

   Gold Brook Campground

-Free Hot Showers

-Wooded or open Tent Sites

-Location on a beautiful stream

-Access to the Stowe Bike Trail

-Badminton, Basketball, Shuffleboard

-Swimming Pool

-3 hours from Portsmouth, NH

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgement.

As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. I have no special training and have not made this trip before.  -Larry Pilla
item.how_to_find_us: Ask for the Seacoast Outdoors campsite
item.name: EXTRA NIGHT(s) @ Stowe Village
